2A8724ADDA44482A8FD4C5E0F472DFA2.description: Comprehend, analyze, and make inferences about the main idea and supporting ideas of oral presentations and authentic spoken and written materials.

94726CF985A1494B88E07EF4222385F3.description: Use a variety of authentic resources, language experiences, and strategies to derive and negotiate meaning more independently.

482104ECC3904BA0BF3AA5A2A3348D85.description:
ADVANCING INDICATOR (REFLECTIVE-REFINING)Students understand spoken and written language that incorporates abstract ideas and complex linguistic structures across a wide variety of topics in the target language.
In the target language:

168D920A1CA545F0B21E6F1F5BDA6A8A.description: Demonstrate understanding of developmentally appropriate information gained through active listening or reading by applying it to a different context.

85BB0F1D81C343B485B966BDF4DFDD32.description: Identify and summarize the main ideas and key supporting ideas of oral and written presentations from various media products and works of literature.

94A97C9603CA4475BA29C7CA5ACF242E.description: Use a variety of resources, prior experiences, and strategies to derive and negotiate meaning.

5B23CCEB2D63472092A1912D61EED85B.description:
DEVELOPING INDICATOR (INTERACTIVE-REFLECTIVE)Students understand spoken and written language on a variety of topics that incorporate abstract ideas and more advanced linguistic structures in the target language.
In the target language:

49DA73AB91FD4ED2AC78F42947C0411F.description: Demonstrate understanding of developmentally appropriate information gained through active listening or reading by applying it to a different context.

550C009E3CF14494A85BE7BBFABCF035.description: Identify the main idea and some supporting details from selected authentic materials from various media.Â

D7950FC6B5D24F49AB529F2966CC7F8D.description: Use prediction, connections to prior experiences, contextual clues, word order, word attack skills, and various reference materials to derive meaning.

A626F12A9A6343968E35E4C28CAB6618.description:
EMERGING INDICATOR (IMITATIVE-INTERACTIVE)Students understand spoken and written language on familiar topics that incorporates descriptive vocabulary and linguistic structures in the target language.
In the target language:

43BAB943C246407C8A037E7FD1B39861.description: Demonstrate understanding of developmentally appropriate information gained through active listening or reading by applying it to a different context.

C550F761555648B7A3D49509EDB531B8.description: Identify the main idea and some supporting details from authentic spoken and written texts that have visual support.Â

754AB9316A84496C87E99E898B694ED8.description: Interpret the basic message from spoken and written texts that are on very familiar topics.

317C65D5329E45EFB6595259EAE9FC57.description:
BEGINNING INDICATOR (RECEPTIVE-IMITATIVE)Students understand spoken and written language on very familiar topics in the target language that promote the learning of basic linguistic structures
In the target language:

91F1C3A20D7B41B68E68F12018A5AB14.description: INTERPRETIVE: Students understand and interpret the target language in its spoken and written form on a variety of topics.

36DA09AB44594A3090B75BB1479E0D68.description: Give and follow a series of detailed instructions with suggestions on how to complete the task.

708D96EED32C40EA9724A851064FD561.description: Write in a variety of formats, for multiple purposes, and for a variety of audiences, incorporating sophisticated linguistic structures.

D14CEA6417214E0F9E9ED545F8DDFF5A.description: Ask for clarification and paraphrase to ensure understanding.

89A640CC7C054C7D8660434AB367C926.description: Discuss options and negotiate solutions to problems.

0E144E27632E4C3EB12D2116403C75D0.description: Express, defend, and provide complete explanation with substantive detail about personal preferences, feelings and opinions.

029D48CFFA904B14BB93C333A7E317EE.description: Ask and answer a variety of questions that elicit elaboration and substantiation of opinions.

A2B89B348B2F435EBF95E8A038C1D57C.description:
ADVANCING INDICATOR (REFLECTIVE-REFINING)Students discuss or debate a wide variety of topics in the target language from the personal to the abstract level, hypothesizing, persuading, and negotiating to reach a conclusion.
In the target language:

756CE1A726D046149914C46C21093A68.description: Give and follow a series of directions with coaching in order to complete the task.

462AAA5895BA4692BF7B02C678B66A46.description: Write in a variety of formats, for multiple purposes, and for a variety of audiences.

B6801BD1C2C24BCDBCD48E60C699AD8C.description: Ask for clarification and suggest alternative words to ensure understanding.

70DCB051E9BB4322BD872CE1F98C9A09.description: Suggest options for solving problems related to personal needs and needs of others.

C375A8B1B1F54D35A31BDC7EF905E92D.description: Talk about and explain personal preferences, feelings, and opinions.

ECF8F9A89BF349159201E1F8B5ED2036.description: Ask and answer a variety of questions that elicit follow-up questions and requests for more information for elaboration.

E5361123A05648AE808E9211DBA38EA7.description:
DEVELOPING INDICATOR (INTERACTIVE-REFLECTIVE)Students discuss and defend an opinion on selected topics from the personal to the abstract level in the target language.
In the target language:

AAAC866AA9BB4353838E313DBBC7D259.description: Give and follow directions in order to complete a multi-step task.

C863B05EB942407F9F4B2752835DBDCE.description: Write short messages, letters, lists, and simple rhymes.

80B2108B2301404BBEB44A16F9E08D94.description: Ask for clarification to ensure understanding.

954C3FD61499416783A9F99BD40BA744.description: Make suggestions in response to personal needs or circumstances.

A92853DAAF294CAB917CD88AA0BC6A20.description: Talk about personal preferences and feelings and provide limited explanation.

3BDEAABC3CE449C2B34381FF873386C0.description: Ask a variety of simple questions, answer, and give reasons for answers.

A32FE305676243FB987D795815EB5367.description:
EMERGING INDICATOR (IMITATIVE-INTERACTIVE)Students engage in exchanges about familiar and personal topics in the present, past and future in the target language.
In the target language:

7D030D0595FB49FD9FD9A21537ADE2B6.description: Exchange brief messages, emails, postcards, and letters.

A57725D650784C8D96429D08AE75E14C.description: Ask for repetitions and repeat to ensure understanding.

9F43859E07DE4384ACE1C785EFC2EF4D.description: Exchange personal preferences, emotions, and opinions.

30A598DFA7594DE3851F35F076DF5B49.description: Ask and answer simple questions related to family and self.

CFB6D8E17D2541CBAA6C96406AAAF384.description:
BEGINNING INDICATOR (RECEPTIVE-IMITATIVE)Students engage in brief exchanges about personal interests in the target language.
In the target language:

CC0AA2C7FE224170A7EC17AC2FDE4902.description:
INTERPERSONAL: Students exchange information orally and in writing in the target language in a culturally
appropriate manner to provide and obtain information, express feelings and emotions, and exchange opinions.
